article_title: Want a baby? Consider a Czech vacation
article_text:
Want a baby? Consider a Czech vacation Where Americans go for cheap in vitro fertilization

Photo montage by Nick Lehr / The Conversation / CC BY 4.0

In 2008, a friend sent me a link to a Czech company called IVF Holiday. Clicking the link, I saw images of quaint European towns. These were accompanied by pictures of smiling white babies – and promises of affordable and safe rounds of in vitro fertilization (IVF).

article_metadata.author.name: By Amy Speier, University of Texas Arlington

og.description: How Zlín, a town in the Czech Republic, became a mecca for foreigners seeking cheap in vitro fertilization.
og.title: Want a baby? Consider a Czech vacation
